Articles.Content:
I got this error: 
  

drunkdata@puter:~/.steam/steam/steamapps/common/Kerbal Space Program$ ./KSP.x86_64
Set current directory to /home/drunkdata/.local/share/Steam/steamapps/common/Kerbal Space Program
Found path: /home/drunkdata/.local/share/Steam/steamapps/common/Kerbal Space Program/KSP.x86_64
Mono path[0] = '/home/drunkdata/.local/share/Steam/steamapps/common/Kerbal Space Program/KSP_Data/Managed'
Mono path[1] = '/home/drunkdata/.local/share/Steam/steamapps/common/Kerbal Space Program/KSP_Data/Mono'
Mono config path = '/home/drunkdata/.local/share/Steam/steamapps/common/Kerbal Space Program/KSP_Data/Mono/etc'
displaymanager : xrandr version warning. 1.5
client has 3 screens
displaymanager screen (0)(VGA1): 1920 x 1080
Using libudev for joystick management


Importing game controller configs
Aborted (core dumped)

And then found/read this thread,

And i'm pretty sure I have support for 3d Unity:
  

/usr/lib/nux/unity_support_test -p
OpenGL vendor string:   Intel Open Source Technology Center
OpenGL renderer string: Mesa DRI Intel(R) Q35
OpenGL version string:  1.4 Mesa 17.0.7

Not software rendered:    yes
Not blacklisted:          yes
GLX fbconfig:             yes
GLX texture from pixmap:  yes
GL npot or rect textures: yes
GL vertex program:        yes
GL fragment program:      yes
GL vertex buffer object:  yes
GL framebuffer object:    yes
GL version is 1.4+:       yes

Unity 3D supported:       yes

 

but i'm kinda stuck on the "delete the settings.cfg and prefs file", because it doesn't seem like I have the settings.cfg file, nor do I have the prefs file: 
  

name@USR: ~/.steam/steam/steamapps/common/Kerbal Space Program$ ls -a
.            GameData   ksp.desktop     ksp_launch  Launcher_Data    LegalNotice.txt       Physics.cfg  saves   SteamDep.txt
..           Internals       ksp_icon.png   KSP.x86        Launcher.x86       PartDatabase.cfg  readme.txt   Ships    buildID.txt  KSP_Data                 ksp_installer     KSP.x86_64  Launcher.x86_64  Parts             Resources    sounds

name@USR: ~/.config/unity3d/Squad/Kerbal Space Program$ ls -a
.  ..  Player.log

 

Am I not reading that thread right?

On 10/22/2017 at 1:06 AM, ksp_tony said:

And i'm pretty sure I have support for 3d Unity:

For Unity as a whole probably, in the specific case of KSP your hardware is not supported.

On 10/22/2017 at 1:06 AM, ksp_tony said:

OpenGL version string: 1.4 Mesa 17.0.7

For KSP you need a bare minimum version of OpenGL of 2.1 and your graphics card only supports 1.4 , so sorry but you'll need to install KSP on a different computer.
